meanings.definition: Quiet and restrained in manner or behavior.
meanings.sent1: She spoke in a subdued voice during the meeting.
meanings.sent2: The library was filled with subdued whispers.
meanings.sent3: The subdued cat tiptoed around the room, trying not to wake anyone.
meanings.sent4: The subdued colors of the painting gave it a calming effect.
meanings.sent5: The subdued lighting in the restaurant created a cozy atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To bring under control or subjection.
meanings.sent1: The police subdued the suspect before making an arrest.
meanings.sent2: It took several officers to subdue the unruly crowd.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to subdue the flames on the stove before they got out of control.
meanings.sent4: She tried to subdue her excitement when she received the good news.
meanings.sent5: The hero subdued the villain with a swift punch to the jaw.

meanings.definition: To tone down or soften in intensity or color.
meanings.sent1: She subdued the bright red paint with a touch of white.
meanings.sent2: The artist subdued the harsh lines in the drawing to create a more gentle look.
meanings.sent3: The chef had to subdue the spiciness of the dish for the sensitive diner.
meanings.sent4: The speaker subdued his anger before addressing the audience.
meanings.sent5: The sunset subdued the vibrant hues of the sky into a peaceful twilight.
